ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH ECG Original Units Terminology Unit of Measure
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) ECG Original Units terminology._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.

Concepts.definition: A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

Concepts.definition: A unit of time equal to one thousandth of a second (10E-3 second).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

Concepts.definition: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EGORRESU
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: May be included if quantitative results are recorded. Because units for quantitative ECG results are typically limited, units should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than having the sites record the units. This item is not necessary for qualitative results.
